Package view

Class TicketsScreen

java.lang.Object
view.TicketsScreen
All Implemented Interfaces:
ActionListener, EventListener
public class TicketsScreen extends Object implements ActionListener
The TicketsScreen class is responsible for the screen that lists all the tickets associated with an itinerary. It allows viewing the attributes of each ticket and also displays buttons to edit them.
Author:
Gabriel Fernando

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    TicketsScreen(Company company, int id)
    Constructor of the TicketsScreen class that adds a container with the information about the respective ticket and the corresponding buttons to edit and delete a ticket.

  • Constructor Details

    • TicketsScreen

      public TicketsScreen(Company company, int id)
      Constructor of the TicketsScreen class that adds a container with the information about the respective ticket and the corresponding buttons to edit and delete a ticket.
      Parameters:
      company - the company logged in
      id - the id of the itinerary
      See Also:
      • actionPerformed(ActionEvent)
      • button(JButton, String)
      • goBack(JButton, String)

  • Method Details

    • populateTickets

      public void populateTickets(ArrayList<Ticket> tickets)
      Populates the allTicketsContainer with the provided list of tickets. If the list of tickets is empty, the container will display a page indicating that there are no registered tickets and displays a button to create tickets.
      Parameters:
      tickets - the list of tickets to be displayed

    • ticket

      public JPanel ticket(int index, float price, int seatNumber, String seatType)
      Creates and returns a JPanel that contains buttons to edit and delete a ticket, and also displays the ticket information.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the ticket
      price - the price of the ticket
      seatNumber - the seat number
      seatType - the seat type
      Returns:
      the JPanel representing the ticket

    • button

      public JButton button(JButton button, String text)
      Configures a button with the provided text and custom styling settings, which changes the background color of the button when the mouse cursor hovers over it, and restores the original color when the mouse moves away.
      Parameters:
      button - the button to be configured
      text - the text to be displayed on the button
      Returns:
      the configured button

    • editTicket

      public JButton editTicket(int index)
      Creates and returns a configured and styled JButton for editing a ticket. The method also adds an ActionListener to the button, so that when the button is clicked, the actionPerformed method informs the controller about the index of the ticket to be updated, closes the ticket window, and opens a new window for ticket editing.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the ticket to be edited
      Returns:
      the configured JButton for editing

    • deleteTicket

      public JButton deleteTicket(int index)
      Creates and returns a configured and styled JButton for deleting a ticket. The method also adds an ActionListener to the button, so that when the button is clicked, the actionPerformed method closes the ticket window and opens it again to update the ticket list.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the ticket to be deleted
      Returns:
      the configured JButton for deletion

    • goBack

      public JButton goBack(JButton goBackButton, String text)
      Configures a back button with the provided text and custom styling, underlining the button when the mouse cursor hovers over it and returning to normal when the mouse moves away.
      Parameters:
      goBackButton - the back button to be configured
      text - the text to be displayed on the button
      Returns:
      the configured button

    • actionPerformed

      public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent event)
      This method identifies whether the "back" button or the "Edit" button in the interface have been clicked. If the "back" button is clicked, the program returns to the company itineraries screen. If the "Edit" button is clicked, it opens a screen for the associated tickets of the respective itinerary.
      Specified by:
      actionPerformed in interface ActionListener
      Parameters:
      event - the event captured by an ActionListener
